comment: Don't know why his difficulty level is a 3.2. Literally just do what youre told and its an easy A. He's really funny and makes class enjoyable. You always get out earlier and as long as you do the work, youll pass. If you don't get an A or a B then you did something wrong.

Professor Jolley is a great teacher! He cares about his students and grades assignments respectably. He does require attendance but most classes get canceled. He requires assignments be submitted on time and not a minute late, but most small ones can be finished in a reasonable amount of time. Hes a great teacher with helpful feedback!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: An amazing person, I had never liked English before I had his class. Highly recommend, very nice and easy to talk to!

Professor Jolley was one of my favorites this semester. He is really easy going and wants you to do well. There are small writing homework assignments from the textbook that will help boost your grade if you are not a strong writer. He will give you feedback if you ASK. He takes attendance but he is such a cool professor you wouldn't want to skip.

Takes attendance which turns a lot of people off, but you're paying for the class so you might as well show up for it. He is picky with grammar, but that made me a better writer. He offers feedback if you ask. A lot of easy hw to help offset any bad writing grades. Prof. Jolley is very friendly and enjoys interacting with his students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: He's a great teacher that is passionate about his subject. He expects everyone to put in effort and do their work because there are a lot of papers and book reading, but it's worth it to maintain a good grade. He is a very enjoyable teacher, and gives great feedback.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Jolley was probably one of my favorite teachers this semester. He is funny and overall a great person in and out the classroom. He does assign a lot of homework, but you know about it ahead of time, and you do not need the lecture to do them. The lectures consist of review on what the essay needs to have and working on the essays itself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Doesn't help much. doesn't even look you in the eye when he speaks to you and makes you feel stupid. I really enjoying learning and becoming a better student and he made  me not want to write at all.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: We read stuff and get grades but he doesn't talk about it.
A good guy. Funny but serious about writing.
He is a great guy but you have to do the work.

Won't lie, if you can't write, you're screwed. He is a tough grader and assigns a lot of homework. The homework helps boost grades-so take advantage. I recommend going to the writing lab to look over your papers. I got an A, but I spent a lot of time on my papers. Attendance counts, so take the easy points.

Honestly you need to be able to write to do well in here. He is very tough at grading and very vague with his instructions. I recommend getting on his good side from day one, it helps a ton. He takes attendance. You have lots of homework assignments, but he tends to give everyone good grades on them.
Dont ask many questions. He  gets easily irritated and will make you feel stupid with your Qs.

the class is not bad at all. There are 4 essays and I hate english and got 2 A's a B and a C. I only got the C because my essay did not have a conclusion. I ended with a mid B, but only because I didn't do some of the hw assigned.

You have 4 major essays. His feedback on them isn't very good. Most classes are a wast of time, but you should go because he gives out pop quizzes. Also while going to the writing center is a good idea, what they say and what he says are very different so you may not get the grade you thought you would on a paper.
Overall pretty easy.

He was a pretty good teacher who didn't give many assignments. There are only four major essays that is worth a total of half your grade, and as long as you follow the rubric you should do fine. He was pretty nice and would make jokes during class. Since it's an English class attendance is mandatory so make sure you come to class.

Not a teacher. More like postition filler. He gave me as much help as a substitute would. He doesn't make his guidelines clear then everyone messes up on the assignment. Most classes were a waste of time.
The class is not that bad, all you have to do is read the chapters, which I have not done, and you'll have an okay time in the class.

I only gave him 1s because I couldn't do 0. He is the least unhelpful teacher I have ever had. You ask him a question about the directions and he simply tells you to "read the directions" but that's what my question was about. He is also pretty self obsessed. He's a difficult grader and some of his edits on your paper are actually wrong.

He doesn't help with making you a better writer. After every assignment he has told the class that not many people understood or did the assignment correctly. Maybe he should explain the assignment better. We show up to class talk for ten minutes the write something that may not even be graded.
